about_us_text_1: We are a collaboration between the California State University of Los Angeles, local nonprofit agencies, and other institutions. We seek to increase financial capability, and ultimately financial well-being, of anyone who wishes to join us
about_us_text_2: ABC Membership is free and confidential. If you promise to share the information without judgment or advice, you will also receive a free Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) Your Money, Your Goals (YMYG) toolkit and workbooks. These are just some of the tools we use to increase our members’ financial empowerment and to encourage others to join us.
about_us_text_2_bak: We want to see you become financially empowered and to financially empower others. Membership is free and confidential. If you promise to share the information without judgment or advice, you will also receive a free Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Your Money, Your Goals toolkit and workbooks.
about_us_text_3: Latino families lost about two-thirds of their wealth in the Great Recession (Pew Research, 2011). Without intervention, African Americans will need 228 years and Latinos 84 years to accumulate the amount of wealth whites have today (Collins, Asante-Muhammed, Nieves, & Hoxie, 2016). Asset-building community products (e.g. matched savings accounts) can help rebuild this wealth. Yet it is challenging for service providers to recruit vulnerable clients to such programs (Padua and Doran, 2016). Over 90% of the annual federal asset building budget ($348 billion of $385 billion) is spent on tax deductions for the highest income earners, leaving little funding for public programs that help struggling families build wealth (Woo, Radamacher, Meier, 2010).  ABC strives to ease the path to financial well-being. We promote financial empowerment by guiding persons and institutions to local asset building programs and services.
about_text_4: The Asset Building Clinic is a collaboration between the California State University of Los Angeles, local nonprofit agencies, and other institutions.  We seek to enhance the financial well-being of anyone who wishes to join us by promoting financial capability through literacy and inclusion. We empower our members to act in their best financial interests by helping them teach themselves and others about financial products and services. Our members are encouraged to perform financially empowering acts with the ultimate goal of helping themselves as well as their communities build assets.
about_text_5: ABC seeks your partnership in creating a community level change, with East Los Angeles as the epi-center for financial empowerment. ABC Membership is free, confidential, and open to anyone interested in joining us. If you promise to share the information without judgment or advice, you will also receive a free Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) Your Money, Your Goals (YMYG) toolkit and workbooks. These are just some of the tools we use to increase our members’ financial empowerment.
a_financially_empowering: A financially empowering act is something that could help you or others have
abc_is_grateful: ABC is deeply grateful for the support we received from institutions.
abc_pays: ABC pays people to perform financially empowering acts. We give points for every financially empowered act you document completing, whether for yourself or others. Both giving and receiving are equally important -- you can’t share what you never learned. Paying ourselves is also important. Even the smallest rewards can shape habits. Since you don’t have to spend your points until you want to, you can be sure that whatever reward you choose will be one you love.
as_we_seek_to_do: As we seek to do more with less, the increasing complexity of our financial world can be daunting, if not overwhelming. What is a prepaid debit card, and does it matter it is not issued by a bank? Does overdraft protection really protect you from overdrafts? Is a car title loan a good option in a financial pinch? Are CDs a good investment?
additional_comments_about_the_reward_pro: Additional comments about the reward provider
as_fellow_travelers: As fellow travelers on the road to financial empowerment, we intimately understand how dealing with finances can prompt severe anxiety… or tremendous boredom. We can also relate to the joy of finally understanding something important about our personal finances and the financial world within which we operate. Not just joy, but also a desire to share this knowledge with others

amount_of_users_short: Amount of users who can execute this act
in_four: in four libraries and on Financial Literacy and Financial Planning Days.
we_partnered: . We partnered with LAPD to provide financially empowering services for their
we_used_cfbp: . We used CFBP’s Your Money, Your Goals Toolkit for Social Service workers to train students in the Financial Empowerment elective.  The CFBP also sent us free materials to promote savings at tax time, and additional training for volunteers. The CFBP provides all these products and services free to the community.
abc_is_proud: . ABC is proud to have been selected as one of the 61 organizations nation-wide in the
traning_for_social: training for social workers in the Financial Empowerment class. Cal State LA is the first Hispanic-Serving University to partner with CSD FCAB project.
cal_state_la: Cal State LA Federal Credit Union
the_credit_union: . The credit union has supported ABC's Annual Celebrations from the beginning. Thank you!
the_centers_high: . The Center’s High Impact Community Engagement Mentorship Project provides stipends to many of the students performing the navigation, and seed funding for the project.
cal_state_la_center: Cal State LA Center for Engagement, Service, and the Public Good
the_los_angeles: . The Los Angeles AEI is an FDIC initiative focused primarily in the City of Los Angeles, California, and is comprised of a broad-base of participating organizations representing financial institutions, community nonprofit organizations, and government agencies. ABC promotes saving pledges through
we_contacted: We contacted these organizations for partnership because of the programs and services they offer to the community. They responded generously, providing our students with free financial counseling and coaching, savings programs, and supervision during our navigation at VITA sites. We recommend others try their excellent programs.
become_a_member_of_abc: Become a member of ABC and join us in enhancing financial wellbeing for us all.
but_others: , but others might find valuable? Someone should find any of these rewards to be wonderfully motivating! This is why we give you points for offering and providing rewards.

enhancing_asset_building: ENHANCING ASSET BUILDING AND FINANCIAL CAPABILITY
follow_instructions: Follow instructions for offering a reward, from our Acts menu
homepage_text_1: With the nearly half of Americans (46%) unable to come up with $400 in the event of an emergency[1] and communities of color on the road to a median of zero wealth if we maintain status quo [2], it is imperative we do something. But what?
join_us_today: We have services designed to foster wealth-building opportunities for the most vulnerable populations in Los Angeles. We also provide a platform to accelerate community-level change, as individuals are incentivised to engage in financially empowering acts - and then share the knowledge they gain with others.

abc_founding_member: ABC’s founding member is Joanna [P: ; she/her/hers] K. Doran, PhD, MSW, and assistant professor in the School of Social Work in California State University in Los Angeles. Dr. Doran currently manages ABC and welcomes anyone to join us in expanding ABC’s operations.
our_members: Our members! Everyone either knows something or has something that someone else would need or love. We make it easy for you to share.
we_can_invite: We can invite someone to join us, and encourage them to come up with other ways to build financial empowerment
we_can_find: We can help someone check their credit report or let them know where to get their taxes filed
we_can_learn: We can learn about, and take part in, local programs that help people save money and improve their credit
we_can_take_free: We can take free financial courses or attend public talks
with_the_majority: With the majority of Americans unable to come up with $400 in the event of an emergency and communities of color on the road to a median of zero wealth if we do nothing, there is a strong undercurrent of economic stress that threatens our democracy. How are people supposed to set aside money to get ahead? We believe larger systemic changes can help, such as directing the federal budget for asset building to invest in the majority of Americans, rather than its highest earners. We also believe that there is plenty for us to do while we wait for the larger changes.
where_do_we_get: Where do we get the rewards?
we_do_not_judge: We do not judge and we do not give advice. Membership is confidential and free.
whenever_you_like: Whenever you like or need, spend your points on rewards
what_could_you_offer: What could you offer? Perhaps you know how to cook something others find complicated? Do you have the patience to teach kids the multiplication table? Maybe you have an object that no longer
whenever_you_like_or_need: Whenever you like or need, spend your points on rewards
we_provide: We provide you with clear instructions for checking credit reports, enhancing financial education, and exploring safe financial products designed to reduce debt, grow savings, and buy assets. Most people do not know such services exist, and this is why we make it easy for you to access them.
we_would_not_blame: We would not blame you if just thinking about your finances causes you anxiety, irritation… or tremendous boredom.
we_also: We also found a way to reward each other for financially empowering ourselves and our communities. Each act is worth points, which can be redeemed for rewards.
how_are_we_supposed_to_get_ahead: How are we supposed to get ahead?
